value.title: Take Your Power BI Visualization to the Next Level using Small Multiples
value.excerpt: Small multiple is a relatively recent feature on some of the Power BI visuals. This feature enables you to have a much better visualization instead of trying to fit everything in one visual (over-complicate it) or create copies of the same visual (maintenance issue in the future). This is a simple feature
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HFjR--rPUSw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Trim Vs Clean in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: When applying text transformations in Power BI using Power Query; two very important transformations that can help are; Trim and Clean. These two mistakenly often considered to do one thing, but they are different. In this short article and video, I’ll explain their differences through an example. find

value.title: Visualization Tip   Change to Filter instead of highlight   Control the Interaction in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI reports are highly interactive, If you select a column in a column chart other charts will be highlighted. Selecting a slicer value will filter all other visuals in the report. This interactivity can be controlled easily. Despite the fact that this feature has been released in early phases of
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hZib9vuh810" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: What a Power BI Hierarchy Is and How to Use it
value.excerpt: Power BI hierarchies are a useful structure for drill-down and data exploration in reports. A hierarchy can be created simply and can add great value for you as a developer and end-users for better data analysis. In this article and video, I’ll explain what a Power BI hierarchy is and how to create it.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tZoBHwS_5rc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: What are the Use Cases of Dataflow for You in Power BI
value.excerpt: There have been lots of announcements about Dataflow online, through videos and articles and news. There are many demos about Dataflow as well. However, still when I talk about it in conferences, one of the main questions from the audience is that; “What are use cases for it?”. In this video, I’m going

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Comparing with previous selected time period in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes how you can create a comparison with the previous time period in a visualization, regardless of whether the time periods are consecutive or not: https://sql.bi/526183/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables)  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. Article and download: https://sql.bi/27271/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Creating a calculated table with DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to write and test the expression for a calculated table in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Customize default values for each user in Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Learn how to use calculation groups to define a default set of values for columns in your model. Different users can have different default values, and yet retain the full capability to select different values. Article and download: https://sql.bi/717242?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Distinguishing HASONEVALUE from ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: This video describes the differences between HASONEVALUE and ISINSCOPE, which are two useful DAX functions to control the filters and the grouping that are active in a report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662962?aff=yt

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Highlighting the minimum and maximum values in a Power BI matrix
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use DAX and conditional formatting together to highlight the minimum and maximum values in a matrix in Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662096?aff=yt

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX

The 3rd edition of Tabular Editor has just been released, and it is a major upgrade from version 2. TE 3 is not [...]Read More »

value.title: Build a P&L in Power BI Without Any DAX
value.excerpt: This is the third article where I have covered building a P&L in Power BI. My first 2 articles here and here focused on how to use the DAX language to solve some of the common problems with P&L reporting, such as adding sub totals into the visual, % of [...]Read More »

value.title: Building a Matrix with Asymmetrical Columns and Rows in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written a few articles that are related to this topic (articles that utilise this same technique to solve a problem), but never before have I explained the stand alone concept of how to build a visual with asymmetrical columns and rows in Power BI.  Let me explain with [...]Read More »

value.title: Building a P&L in Power BI – Part 2 (Percentages)
value.excerpt: I blogged about how to Build a P&L With Power BI back in April 2020, and the response from my readers was great. Several people asked how to add percentages such as % of net sales revenue, % gross profit, etc. into the P&L. I decided therefore to do a [...]Read More »

value.title: Building A Power BI (COVID) Report From Scratch
